etymology.description: 枕(枕) (zhěn, "pillow") originally referred to an object to rest your head, and 頭(头) (tóu, "head") specifies the purpose of the pillow, indicating it is for the head.
etymology.interpretation: 枕頭(枕头) (zhěntou, "pillow") combines the concept of a supporting object for the head, making it clear the item is meant to hold or rest the head during sleep or rest.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢用柔软的枕头(我喜歡用柔軟的枕頭)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān yòng róuruǎn de zhěntou.
examples.english: I like to use a soft pillow.

examples.chinese: 睡觉时(睡覺時)，我总是需要一个舒服的枕头(我總是需要一個舒服的枕頭)。
examples.pinyin: Shuìjiào shí, wǒ zǒng shì xūyào yī gè shūfu de zhěntou.
examples.english: When sleeping, I always need a comfortable pillow.

examples.chinese: 他送给我一个新枕头(他送給我一個新枕頭)。
examples.pinyin: Tā sòng gěi wǒ yī gè xīn zhěntou.
examples.english: He gave me a new pillow.
